basics.name: Lawrence Zheng
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Engineering in the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2027.

work.company: UHM Department of Electrical & Computer Engineering
work.summary: Worked on chip data validation, custom PCB design, and Verilog firmware development for FPGA-based readout systems
highlights: Developing data acquisition scripts for Advanced Low Power Hybrid Acquisition (ALPHA) ASIC

work.company: UHM Department of Information & Computer Sciences
work.summary: Supported department faculty and staff by troubleshooting and resolving technical issues through helpdesk
highlights: Installed, configured and maintained end-user workstations in an Active Directory forest
Installed, configured, and managed department network infrastructure

volunteer.summary: Developed and cooperated with a team of 30 to compete in the University Rover Challenge.
highlights: Developed ROS2 nodes for real-time teleoperation of a 5-degree-of-freedom robotic arm
Top 21% finish in the 2025 University Rover Challenge, competing against 114 international teams

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Undergraduate students are awarded the UH Mānoa Dean’s List distinction if they earn a UH Mānoa semester grade point average of 3.5 or higher based on 12 credits or more.
